verses.verse: He <S%H376><s%> who is often rebuked <S%H8433><s%> and stiffens <S%H7185><s%> his neck <S%H6203><s%> will be destroyed <S%H7665><s%> suddenly, <S%H6621><s%> with no remedy. <S%H4832><s%>

A man <S%H1397><s%> who flatters <S%H2505><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> spreads <S%H6566><s%> a net <S%H7568><s%> for his feet. <S%H6471><s%>

Mockers <S%H3944><s%> <S%H582><s%> stir <S%H6315><s%> up <S%H6315><s%> a city, <S%H7151><s%> but wise <S%H2450><s%> men turn away <S%H7725><s%> anger. <S%H639><s%>

If a wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H376><s%> goes to court <S%H8199><s%> with a foolish <S%H191><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> the fool rages <S%H7264><s%> or scoffs, <S%H7832><s%> and there is no peace. <S%H5183><s%>
The bloodthirsty <S%H582><s%> hate <S%H8130><s%> a man of integrity; <S%H8535><s%> and they seek <S%H1245><s%> the life <S%H5315><s%> of the upright. <S%H3477><s%>
A fool <S%H3684><s%> vents <S%H3318><s%> all of his anger, <S%H7307><s%> but a wise <S%H2450><s%> man brings <S%H7623><s%> himself under control. <S%H268><s%>

The poor <S%H7326><s%> man <S%H376><s%> and the oppressor <S%H8501><s%> have this in common: <S%H6298><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> gives sight <S%H5869><s%> to the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of both. <S%H8147><s%>
The king <S%H4428><s%> who fairly <S%H571><s%> judges <S%H8199><s%> the poor, <S%H1800><s%> his throne <S%H3678><s%> shall be established <S%H3559><s%> forever. <S%H5703><s%>

The rod <S%H7626><s%> of correction <S%H8433><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> but a child <S%H5288><s%> left <S%H7971><s%> to himself causes shame <S%H954><s%> to his mother. <S%H517><s%>
When the wicked <S%H7563><s%> increase, <S%H7235><s%> sin <S%H6588><s%> increases; <S%H7235><s%> but the righteous <S%H6662><s%> will see <S%H7200><s%> their downfall. <S%H4658><s%>
Correct <S%H3256><s%> your son, <S%H1121><s%> and he will give you peace; <S%H5117><s%> yes, <S%H5414><s%> he will bring delight <S%H4574><s%> to your soul. <S%H5315><s%>
Where there is no revelation, <S%H2377><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> cast off restraint; <S%H6544><s%> but one who keeps <S%H8104><s%> the law <S%H8451><s%> is blessed. <S%H835><s%>
A servant <S%H5650><s%> can't <S%H3256><s%> be corrected by words. <S%H1697><s%> Though he understands, <S%H995><s%> yet he will not respond. <S%H4617><s%>
Do you see <S%H2372><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> who is hasty <S%H213><s%> in his words? <S%H1697><s%> There is more hope <S%H8615><s%> for a fool than for him. <S%H3684><s%>
He who pampers <S%H6445><s%> his servant <S%H5650><s%> from youth <S%H5290><s%> will have him become a son <S%H4497><s%> in the end. <S%H319><s%>
An angry <S%H639><s%> man <S%H376><s%> stirs up <S%H1624><s%> strife, <S%H4066><s%> and a wrathful <S%H2534><s%> man <S%H1167><s%> abounds in <S%H7227><s%> sin. <S%H6588><s%>
A man <S%H120><s%>'s pride <S%H1346><s%> brings him low, <S%H8213><s%> but one of lowly <S%H8217><s%> spirit <S%H7307><s%> gains <S%H8551><s%> honor. <S%H3519><s%>

Whoever is an accomplice <S%H2505><s%> of a thief <S%H1590><s%> is an enemy <S%H8130><s%> of his own soul. <S%H5315><s%> He takes <S%H8085><s%> an oath, <S%H423><s%> but dares not testify. <S%H5046><s%>
The fear <S%H2731><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> proves <S%H5414><s%> to be a snare, <S%H4170><s%> but whoever puts his trust <S%H982><s%> in Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> is kept safe. <S%H7682><s%>
Many <S%H7227><s%> seek <S%H1245><s%> the ruler <S%H4910><s%>'s favor, <S%H6440><s%> but a man <S%H376><s%>'s justice <S%H4941><s%> comes from Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>
A dishonest <S%H5766><s%> man <S%H376><s%> detests <S%H8441><s%> the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> and the upright <S%H3477><s%> in their ways <S%H1870><s%> detest <S%H8441><s%> the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>
